snippet: Debate in the House suggested the fight over how to remake the health care system would continue next year regardless of who wins the elections for Congress and president.
abstract: House of Representatives votes 244 to 185 to repeal the health care overhaul less than two weeks after the Supreme Court upheld it as constitutional; vote, which has no chance of approval in the Senate, exposes the depth of passion over efforts to remake the health care system, and suggests that the fight will continue into 2013, regardless of who wins the presidency.
lead_paragraph: Debate in the House suggested the fight over how to remake the health care system would continue next year regardless of who wins the elections for Congress and president.

headline.seo: House Votes, Again, to Repeal Obama Health Care Law
headline.main: Repeal of Health Care Law Approved, Again, by House
headline.print_headline: Repeal of Health Care Law Approved, Again, by House

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
